programme.desc: "Pete Smith Specialty" short looks at modern, mid-20th-century household items and furniture that aren't necessarily as important or useful as one would suspect. Dave O'Brien. Narrated by Pete Smith(c)

programme.title: Adam's Rib
programme.desc: Battle-of-the-sexes comedy in which the marriage between husband-and-wife lawyers reaches a breaking point when they become courtroom rivals in the attempted-murder case of a Brooklyn woman who tried to kill her philandering husband and his mistress. Ruth Gordon and Garson Kanin's screenplay was nominated for an Oscar. (cc)(c)

programme.title: The Reformer and the Redhead
programme.desc: A spoof on politics involves a fearsome lion, a mayoral candidate and the idealistic daughter of a zookeeper with whom he falls in love after she joins his campaign in an attempt to get her father's job back after he was fired by the incumbent machine. Stars Dick Powell and June Allyson were married at the time. (cc)(c)

programme.title: M
programme.desc: Joseph Losey's controversial remake of the 1931 classic about a child killer who is wanted by cops and criminals alike(c)

programme.title: The Tender Trap
programme.desc: Frank Sinatra plays a womanizing Manhattan showbiz agent who gets involved with an aspiring actress who is out to snare a husband, and has ever so subtly set the bait. The title tune was nominated for a Best Song Oscar. (cc)(c)

programme.title: Jimmy Fund At Home With Joan Crawford
programme.desc: Short film features actress Joan Crawford soliciting donations for a charity fund that raises money for children with cancer(c)

programme.title: The Naked Hills
programme.desc: The life of a prospector lured to California by the 1849 gold rush. He fails and returns home to Indiana, but even the birth of his son won't keep him from his undiscovered fortune. (cc)(c)

programme.title: The Three Faces of Eve
programme.desc: Joanne Woodward's Oscar-winning performance as a housewife with three personalities. Lee J. Cobb, David Wayne. Nunnally Johnson directed and also wrote the screenplay from an actual case history. An intriguing study of mental illness, with overtones of comedy; tongue-in-cheek narration by Alistair Cooke. (cc)(c)

programme.title: The Last Angry Man
programme.desc: Paul Muni's last film is a tale of a dedicated old doctor in Brooklyn's slums. David Wayne, Betsy Palmer, Joby Baker. Mrs. Quincy: Claudia McNeil. Vogul: Luther Adler. Alice: Joanna Moore. Gattling: Robert F. Simon. Nobody Home: Godfrey Cambridge. Directed by Daniel Mann. (cc)(c)

programme.title: Huckleberry Finn
programme.desc: Musical adaptation of Mark Twain's 1884 classic about a runaway orphan and a fugitive slave who share adventures on a river raft going down the Mississippi. (cc)(c)

programme.title: In Cold Blood
programme.desc: Adaptation of Truman Capote's fact-based crime novel about two drifters who attempt to rob a farmhouse and end up murdering a rural family. Richard Brooks was nominated for Best Director and his script was nominated for Best Adapted Screenplay. (cc)(c)

programme.title: 10 Rillington Place
programme.desc: Semidocumentary about the real-life Christie-Evans case in which a 1940s British serial killer lured sickly middleaged women to his London flat, where he murdered them, assaulted their dead bodies and then buried them. (cc)(c)

programme.title: The Honeymoon Killers
programme.desc: Fact-based docudrama about an obese, unlucky-at-love woman and a suave con artist who team up and travel the country fleecing lonely, unsuspecting women out of their life savings. Eventually growing jealous of her partner's romancing wealthy strangers, she adds murder to her rap sheet. (cc)(c)

programme.title: Dog Day Afternoon
programme.desc: A bank robbery in Brooklyn goes wrong and evolves into a protracted hostage situation, turning the plan's mastermind into a media celebrity and the event into a media circus. Based on a true story. (cc)(c)

programme.title: The Phenix City Story
programme.desc: Fact-based exposé about a crusading Southern lawyer who takes on an organized-crime operation in his attempts to clean up "the wickedest city in the United States." (cc)(c)

programme.title: Sweet Kitty Bellairs
programme.desc: Ornate operetta, set in 18th-century England, depicts the romance of a free-spirited young lady and a dashing highwayman(c)

programme.title: Swordsman of Siena
programme.desc: Stewart Granger as a soldier of fortune amid unrest in 16th-century Spain. Serenella: Christine Kaufmann. Orietta: Sylva Koscina. Father Giacomo: Tullio Carminati. Don Carlos: Riccardo Garrone. Paresi: Alberto Lupp. Hugo: Fausto Tozzi. Countess: Marina Berti. Etienne Perier directed. (cc)(c)

programme.title: Anna Karenina
programme.desc: Leo Tolstoy's tragedy, set in tsarist Russia, stars Greta Garbo as a woman married to an indifferent husband and finding herself caught in a tragic love affair with a dashing count. Her indiscretions leave her permanently separated from her beloved son. (cc)(c)

programme.title: Adventures of Don Juan
programme.desc: In 17th-century Spain, the legendary swashbuckling lothario defends his queen against a traitorous duke. An uncredited William Faulkner worked on an early draft of the script. (cc)(c)

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Adaptation of Jane Austen's classic 1813 novel about romance and mores in pre-Victorian English society revolves around five middle-class sisters being courted by a variety of suitors. Of special note is the fractious relationship between spirited Elizabeth Bennet and haughty aristocrat Fitzwilliam Darcy. (cc)(c)

programme.title: Another Romance of Celluloid
programme.desc: Examining the process of making movies. Included: a tour of MGM studio's sound stages for a look at films in production. Among the stars making cameos are Norma Shearer, Clark Gable, Mickey Rooney, Spencer Tracy and Myrna Loy(c)

programme.title: Wuthering Heights
programme.desc: William Wyler's Best Picture nominee is based on Emily Bronte's classic tale of the star-crossed romance between a materialistic girl (Merle Oberon) and a proud stable boy (Laurence Olivier) on the Yorkshire moors. Gregg Toland's lyrical cinematography won an Oscar. (cc)(c)

programme.title: The Lion in Winter
programme.desc: Adaptation of the play about royal-family intrigue in 1183 involving King Henry II, his estranged wife Eleanor of Aquitaine and their three sons who make up the line of succession. (cc)(c)

programme.title: Brewster's Millions
programme.desc: Penniless ex-GI Monty Brewster inherits $8 million from a rich relative, but there's a catch. To get the dough, he first has to spend a million in the course of a month, and nobody can know why he's doing it. (cc)(n)

programme.title: Once a Thief
programme.desc: The downfall of a girl (June Havoc) who comes under the spell of a heel (Cesar Romero). Marie McDonald, Lon Chaney, Iris Adrian. W. Lee Wilder directed(n)

programme.title: Sing Your Worries Away
programme.desc: A lowdown gangster hatches a plot to steal a daffy songwriter's newly inherited fortune by first driving the man to suicide, and then claiming the dough for himself. (cc)(n)

programme.title: Cab Calloway in 'Hi De Ho'
programme.desc: A gypsy reads bandleader Cab Calloway's fortune, which leads to performances of several hit songs, including "I Gotta Right to Sing the Blues," "Frisco Flo" and "Hi-De-Ho Miracle Man." Directed by Roy Mack(n)

programme.title: Four Jacks and a Jill
programme.desc: Four musicians seek a replacement frontwoman after their singer quits the band because her mobster boyfriend is pressuring her to pay more attention to him. (cc)(n)

programme.title: Powder Town
programme.desc: Spies trying to wrest secrets from a scientist (Edmond O'Brien) have to reckon with a burly foreman (Victor McLaglen). June Havoc, Dorothy Lovett, Eddie Foy Jr., Damian O'Flynn. Rowland V. Lee directed. (cc)(n)

programme.title: The Formula
programme.desc: A detective investigates the death of a friend who was involved in a wide-ranging conspiracy among oil companies to manipulate worldwide fuel prices based on a formula for synthetic fuel that had been developed by the Nazis during World War II. (cc)(n)

programme.title: Triple Cross
programme.desc: The true story of Eddie Chapman, a British safecracker who became a double agent during World War II. (cc)(n)

programme.title: The Journey
programme.desc: A bus filled with international travelers flees Budapest during the 1956 revolt and is detained at the border of Austria and Hungary, where a Soviet officer seeks to identify a dissenter wanted by the police. (cc)(n)

programme.title: Catlow
programme.desc: Former saddle pals spar on opposite sides of the law in this tale of post-Civil War Texas. (cc)(n)

programme.title: Romance of a Horsethief
programme.desc: Yugoslav locations highlight this portrait of Jewish peasant life in early 20th-century Poland. Yul Brynner, Eli Wallach, Jane Birkin, Oliver Tobias, Lainie Kazan. Shloime: David Opatoshu. Sigmund: Serge Gainsbourg. Mendel: Henri Sera. Countess: Linda Veras. Abraham Polonsky directed. (cc)(n)

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości

programme.title: Bywanie na dywanie
programme.desc: Paulina Koziejowska i Aleksandra Kot zagłębiają się w świat przemysłu rozrywkowego. Opowiadają o bieżących wydarzeniach z show-biznesu, najświeższych plotkach oraz najgłośniejszych skandalach. Stałymi gośćmi programu są Adrian Nychnerewicz, redaktor "Super Expressu", który podzieli się najnowszymi wieściami z czerwonego dywanu, oraz Michał Kozłowski z Nowa TV, który zdradzi sekrety gwiazd sportu. Widzowie znają już obie gospodynie programu jako prezenterki prognozy pogody na Nowej TV, oprócz tego Aleksandra Kot od kilku lat jest związana ze stacją Eska TV

Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości

programme.title: Bywanie na dywanie
programme.desc: Paulina Koziejowska i Aleksandra Kot zagłębiają się w świat przemysłu rozrywkowego. Opowiadają o bieżących wydarzeniach z show-biznesu, najświeższych plotkach oraz najgłośniejszych skandalach. Stałymi gośćmi programu są Adrian Nychnerewicz, redaktor "Super Expressu", który podzieli się najnowszymi wieściami z czerwonego dywanu, oraz Michał Kozłowski z Nowa TV, który zdradzi sekrety gwiazd sportu. Widzowie znają już obie gospodynie programu jako prezenterki prognozy pogody na Nowej TV, oprócz tego Aleksandra Kot od kilku lat jest związana ze stacją Eska TV
